column1: '''Mermaids''', or water spirits, were creatures only mentioned fleetingly in the earliest versions of the tales of [[Arda]] and linguistic writings of the [[Eldar]].<ref>{{HM
column3: 12}}</ref> Other names for these creatures were '''foam-maidens''', '''foam-fays''', '''foam-riders''',<ref name=MC>{{MC

column1: The mermaids were part of what apparently was a three-fold division of the lesser [[Ainur
column3: sprites]] (spirits of the earth), and water spirits.<ref name=LT1-66>{{LT1

column1: In poems, the foam-fays are described as having "blossom-white hair" shining "in the light of the sun", "pale arms on the sea's bosom", and to be "chanting wild songs".<ref name=MC/> They apparently lived in [[Caverns of the Oaritsi
Ui (the precursor of [[Uinen]]) was given the title "Queen of Mermaids".<ref>{{LT1
A basic division of two groups of water spirits, with their [[Elvish]] names, are given as follow:
*'''''Oarni''''' (troop of [[Ossë]]): "spirits of the sea"; also '''''Oaritsi''''' (from ''oaris'', "mermaid")<ref name=LT1Index>{{LT1

*'''''Falmaríni''''' and '''''Wingildi''''' (troop of [[Ossë]]): "spirits of the sea-foam"<ref name=LT1Index/> (also '''''wingildin''''', "foam-maidens, foam-fays"<ref name=MC/>; '''''wingild-''''' "nymph",<ref name=PE12/> or "foam-maiden"<ref>{{PE
Also mentioned are ''flathwin'' or ''-nir'' "foam fay", and ''nendil'', ''nennil'' "waterfay".<ref>{{PE
column2: 11}}</ref> A [[Qenya]] gloss is given as ''nindari'' ("river-maid, nymph").<ref name=PE21>{{PE

column1: Mermaids are not mentioned in the later versions of the [[legendarium]]. Many of the classes of beings references in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]'' were superseded by the concept of the [[Maiar]], which were not introduced until the reworking of the [[Annals of Valinor]] into the [[Annals of Aman]].<ref name="MRP2b">{{MR
[[Patrick H. Wynne]] and [[Christopher Gilson]] have noted that Tolkien's use of nymphs (and related spirits) is likely influenced by [[Wikipedia:Paracelsus
column2: Paracelsus]]'s chart of four elementals: ''sylphs'' (air), ''pygmies'' or ''gnomes'' (earth), ''nymphs'' (water), and ''salamanders'' (fire).<ref>{{PE
